thread.title: Foley concussion the main injury concern for Tahs
thread.title_full: Foley concussion the main injury concern for Tahs

title: Foley concussion the main injury concern for Tahs
text:
Super Rugby future in doubt 0:42 Bernard Foley’s concussion the big injury concern for NSW Waratahs before opening Super Rugby round February 21, 2017 6:43pm by Adrian Warren of AAP Source: FOX SPORTS A CONCUSSION concern over five-eighth Bernard Foley is the main fitness worry for NSW Waratahs coach Daryl Gibson, as he prepares to throw Super Rugby rookie Irae Simone into Saturday’s opening round clash against the Force. 
The availability of Foley will only be determined on Thursday, following a head knock suffered against the Highlanders in a trial last Thursday. 
Foley was “foggy” on Sunday but has got better each day, Gibson told The Daily Telegraph . Bernard Foley is an injury concern for the Tahs due to a concussion. Source: News Corp Australia 
“He is working through his protocols. We are very mindful of that, we don’t want to see a player out there who isn’t fit,” Gibson said. 
Bryce Hegarty, who sat out last year due to a knee reconstruction but has returned strongly in the trials, is on standby to play No.10. 
Simone and former Brumbies back-rower Michael Wells are the only newcomers to the team, which has 10 Wallabies in the run-on side. 
NSW WARATAHS: Andrew Kellaway, Reece Robinson, Israel Folau, Irae Simone, Rob Horne, Bernard Foley, Nick Phipps, Michael Wells, Michael Hooper (capt), Jack Dempsey, Will Skelton, Dean Mumm, Sekope Kepu, Tolu Latu, Tom Robertson.
